content: inset mosaic crochet pattern just zigzag us terminology general info even though i named the pattern just zigzag it s much more than that it s also triangles mountains and even christmas trees very easy & fast inset mosaic crochet pattern where you work two row in each color so you do not have to cut the yarn no tails no fringe the pattern allows you to create nearly anything you want blanket afghan scarf bag cushion cover… the pattern includes 1 repeated section that you can work as many times as you want so your creation can be as wide and as long as you wish it s recommended to use two or more contrasting same weight yarn colors the chart is created using 2 colors experience level confident beginner language & terminology english us technique inset mosaic crochet the pattern includes  introductory information about inset mosaic crochet  links to video tutorials of inset mosaic crochet basics  chart  pictures stitches chain/chs chain/chains r/rs row/row slip_stitch slip_stitch prev previous st/sts stitch stitches single_crochet single crochet double_crochet double_crochet if you feel like double_crochet is not long enough you may stretch it as much as needed to aline with the single_crochet stitches in the same r or replace it with extended double_crochet © bebablanket | innovative crochet designs 1 inset mosaic crochet basics basic technique  work 2 rs in each color 1 - from front side turn ch1 optional 1 - from back side turn ch1 optional change the color with slip_stitch repeat  do not cut the yarn at the end/beginning of rs carry other color yarn up the side of your work  both sts single_crochet and double_crochet are worked into both loops  all single_crochet sts are worked into next st of prev r  all double_crochet sts are worked into skipped sts 3 rs below in front of ch3 reading charts  the charts include a legend identifying what the symbols mean  when reading charts do not pay attention to the color of the squares it is just for your reference so you know what result you should get you have to pay attention to row number which color to use for that row the direction you are working in empty square = single_crochet x = double_crochet 3 rs below ○ ○ ○ = ch3 tips and tricks  contrasting colors will define the design better  if you crochet tightly choose a larger hook size  use a ruler to hide the rs you have already worked  use a stitch marker to mark the last st of each repeat it will help you to follow the chart and not to get lost  if double_crochet is too short replace it with a taller st exdc useful links  the basics https //youtu be/zx9xvfbbkao yarn hook & approximate size just zizag pattern sample was created using the following yarn color a stylecraft special dk aspen yarn color b ice yarns magic
